title: AI Memory Engine - Self-Learning Database with TRM & SONA
description: Give your AI persistent memory that learns and improves over time. Powered by RuvLLM with TRM recursive reasoning (7M params), SONA adaptive learning, HNSW indexing, and SIMD-optimized inference. Perfect for chatbots, RAG systems, and intelligent agents.

action.title: Action
action.description: Select the operation to perform on your memory database
action.sectionDescription: Choose an action and configure your session. Start with 'Demo' to explore all features with sample data.
enumTitles: Demo - Try all features with sample data
Get - Retrieve a specific memory by ID
List - List memories with pagination and filters
Delete - Remove memories by ID or filter
Clear - Remove all memories from namespace
Batch Search - Run multiple searches at once
Hybrid Search - Combined semantic + keyword search
Build Knowledge - Create knowledge graph from data
Analyze - Analyze patterns with SONA insights
Feedback - Provide feedback to improve SONA learning
Integrate: Synthetic Data - Generate and store mock data
Integrate: Web Scraper - Scrape and memorize content
Integrate: Actor - One-click memory from any Apify actor
Integrate: Neural Trading - AI trading signals with memory
Natural Language - Execute commands in plain English
Export: Vector DB - Export to Pinecone, Weaviate, etc.
Learn - Force SONA background learning cycle

sessionId.title: Session ID
sessionId.description: Unique identifier to persist memories across multiple Actor runs. Use the same Session ID to continue where you left off. Leave empty for one-time runs.

namespace.title: Memory Namespace
namespace.description: Organize memories into separate collections (like folders). Different namespaces are completely isolated.

memories.title: Memories to Store
memories.description: Text content to store in memory. Each item becomes a searchable memory with vector embeddings.
memories.sectionDescription: Add, search, update, and manage your memories. Each memory is automatically converted to a vector embedding for semantic search.

prefill.text: The customer prefers fast shipping over lower prices
Product X works best with Product Y for home automation
User asked about return policy on December 10th

query.title: Search Query
query.description: What are you looking for? The engine uses semantic understanding to find relevant memories even with different wording.

queries.title: Batch Search Queries
queries.description: Multiple search queries to run in parallel. Each query returns its own set of results.

memoryId.title: Memory ID
memoryId.description: Unique identifier of a specific memory for get/delete/update operations

memoryIds.title: Memory IDs (Batch)
memoryIds.description: Array of memory IDs for batch delete operation

updates.title: Memory Updates
updates.description: Fields to update on a memory. You can update text, metadata, or both.

metadataFilter.title: Metadata Filter
metadataFilter.description: Filter memories by metadata fields. Only memories matching ALL specified fields are affected.

topK.title: Number of Results
topK.description: Maximum number of similar memories to return
topK.sectionDescription: Fine-tune how semantic search works. These settings affect search, batch_search, and hybrid_search actions.

similarityThreshold.title: Similarity Threshold
similarityThreshold.description: Minimum similarity score required. Higher values return more relevant but fewer results.

distanceMetric.title: Distance Metric
distanceMetric.description: Algorithm used to measure similarity between memory vectors
enumTitles: Euclidean - L2 distance for numerical data
Dot Product - Fast, good for normalized vectors
Manhattan - L1 distance, robust to outliers

keywordWeight.title: Keyword Weight (Hybrid Search)
keywordWeight.description: Weight given to exact keyword matching in hybrid search. Set to 0 for pure semantic search.

semanticWeight.title: Semantic Weight (Hybrid Search)
semanticWeight.description: Weight given to semantic similarity in hybrid search. Set to 1 for pure semantic search.

limit.title: Results per Page
limit.description: Maximum number of memories to return when listing
limit.sectionDescription: Control how memories are listed and paginated. Use offset for pagination through large result sets.

offset.title: Skip Results
offset.description: Number of memories to skip for pagination (e.g., offset=100 starts at the 101st result)

sortBy.title: Sort By
sortBy.description: Field to sort list results by
enumTitles: Created At - When the memory was added
Updated At - When the memory was last modified
Access Count - How often the memory was retrieved

duplicateThreshold.title: Duplicate Similarity Threshold
duplicateThreshold.description: How similar memories must be to be considered duplicates. 0.95 = very similar, 1.0 = exact match.
duplicateThreshold.sectionDescription: Find and remove duplicate or near-duplicate memories to keep your database clean.

chatMessage.title: Your Message
chatMessage.description: Your message to the AI assistant. The assistant will use stored memories to provide context-aware responses.
chatMessage.sectionDescription: Have conversations with an AI that remembers everything. Configure your preferred AI provider and model.
chatMessage.prefill: What products would you recommend based on my preferences?

chatHistory.title: Conversation History
chatHistory.description: Previous messages in the conversation for context. Each message has a 'role' (user/assistant) and 'content'.

prefill.content: Based on your preferences, I recommend Product X.

provider.title: AI Provider
provider.description: Which AI service to use for chat and advanced features
enumTitles: Local - RuvLLM only (no external API needed)

apiKey.title: AI Provider API Key
apiKey.description: Your API key for the selected provider. Get free Gemini key at ai.google.dev

model.title: AI Model
model.description: Which language model to use for chat and generation
enumTitles: Gemini 1.5 Pro - Most capable Gemini model

sonaEnabled.title: Enable SONA Learning
sonaEnabled.description: SONA (Self-Optimizing Neural Architecture) continuously improves search quality based on usage patterns
sonaEnabled.sectionDescription: SONA is a 3-tier learning system that improves over time. It learns from your interactions to provide better search results and recommendations.
sonaEnabled.groupDescription: Enable or disable various learning capabilities

learningEnabled.title: Enable Interaction Learning
learningEnabled.description: Learn from search queries and feedback to improve future results

forceBackgroundLearning.title: Force Learning Cycle
forceBackgroundLearning.description: Run a SONA background learning cycle after this operation completes

ewcLambda.title: Anti-Forgetting Strength (EWC++)
ewcLambda.description: How strongly to prevent forgetting old patterns when learning new ones. Higher = more conservative learning.

patternThreshold.title: Pattern Confidence Threshold
patternThreshold.description: Minimum confidence required to learn a new pattern. Higher = only learn strong patterns.

knowledgeGraphEnabled.title: Build Knowledge Graph
knowledgeGraphEnabled.description: Automatically extract entities and relationships from stored memories to build a knowledge graph
knowledgeGraphEnabled.sectionDescription: Extract entities (people, products, concepts) and their relationships to enable graph-based queries and recommendations.

feedbackRating.title: Result Rating
feedbackRating.description: Rate the quality of a search result or recommendation to help SONA learn (5 = perfect, 1 = irrelevant)
feedbackRating.sectionDescription: Provide feedback on search results to improve future performance. SONA uses this feedback to fine-tune its understanding.

feedbackCorrection.title: Correction Text
feedbackCorrection.description: If a memory is incorrect, provide the correct text here. SONA will learn from this correction.

exportFormat.title: Export Format
exportFormat.description: File format for exporting your memory database
exportFormat.sectionDescription: Export your memories for backup or migration. Import data from files or other systems.
enumTitles: Embeddings - Raw vectors for ML pipelines

vectorDbFormat.title: Vector DB Export Format
vectorDbFormat.description: Export in a format compatible with popular vector databases

importData.title: Import Data
importData.description: JSON data to import into memory. Should contain an array of memories with text and optional metadata.

actorId.title: Actor to Integrate
actorId.description: Select a popular actor or enter any Apify actor ID (owner/actor-name)
actorId.sectionDescription: One-click integration with 25+ popular Apify actors. Automatically fetch data and memorize it for semantic search. Use 'Custom Actor' to integrate any actor.
enumTitles: Google Maps - Local businesses, reviews, locations
News - News articles from multiple sources
Synthetic Data Generator - AI-generated test data
Neural Trader System - Trading signals & analysis
Custom Actor - Enter custom actor ID below

customActorId.title: Custom Actor ID
customActorId.description: Enter the full actor ID (e.g., username/actor-name) when using 'Custom Actor' option

actorCategory.title: Filter by Category
actorCategory.description: Filter actors by category to find the right one faster
enumTitles: Local & Maps - Google Maps, Yelp, TripAdvisor
Social Media - Instagram, Twitter, TikTok, Reddit
Content - Google Search, News, RSS feeds
Data Generators - Synthetic data, Trading signals

actorRunMode.title: Data Source
actorRunMode.description: Where to get the actor's data from
enumTitles: Latest Run - Use data from the actor's most recent run
Specific Run - Provide a specific run ID
Fresh Run - Start a new actor run with custom input
Dataset Only - Access a specific dataset directly
Discovery Mode - List all supported actors (no data fetch)

actorRunId.title: Specific Run ID
actorRunId.description: Run ID to fetch data from (when using 'Specific Run' mode)

actorDatasetId.title: Dataset ID
actorDatasetId.description: Dataset ID to fetch data from (when using 'Dataset Only' mode)

actorInput.title: Actor Input (Fresh Run)
actorInput.description: Input configuration for starting a fresh actor run

actorConfig.title: Memory Settings
actorConfig.description: Configure how actor data is processed and stored in memory

actorTimeout.title: Actor Timeout
actorTimeout.description: Maximum wait time for fresh actor runs (in seconds). Longer timeouts allow more data but cost more.

actorMemoryLimit.title: Actor Memory (MB)
actorMemoryLimit.description: Memory allocation for fresh actor runs (higher = faster but costs more)

integrationConfig.title: Synthetic Data Configuration
integrationConfig.description: Settings for generating and memorizing synthetic test data

scraperConfig.title: Web Scraper Configuration
scraperConfig.description: Configure web pages to scrape and memorize

tradingSymbols.title: Trading Symbols
tradingSymbols.description: Crypto/stock symbols to analyze and generate trading signals for
tradingSymbols.sectionDescription: Connect to Neural Trader System for AI-powered trading signals. Signals are stored as searchable memories for pattern analysis and strategy backtesting.

tradingStrategy.title: Trading Strategy
tradingStrategy.description: Neural network strategy to use for signal generation
enumTitles: LSTM Prediction - Time series pattern recognition

memorizeSignals.title: Store Trading Signals
memorizeSignals.description: Save generated trading signals as searchable memories for later analysis

memorizeMarketData.title: Store Market Data
memorizeMarketData.description: Also store market data (price, volume, indicators) alongside signals

signalConfidenceThreshold.title: Signal Confidence Threshold
signalConfidenceThreshold.description: Minimum confidence level required to store a signal (0-100). Higher = only store high-conviction signals.

searchTradingHistory.title: Search Trading History
searchTradingHistory.description: Instead of generating new signals, search existing trading memories

tradingHistoryQuery.title: Trading History Query
tradingHistoryQuery.description: Search query for finding relevant trading signals and market data in memory
tradingHistoryQuery.prefill: high confidence BUY signals for BTC

tradingActorConfig.title: Neural Trader Actor Settings
tradingActorConfig.description: Advanced configuration for the Neural Trader System actor

template.title: Template
template.description: Load a pre-built memory template optimized for specific use cases
template.sectionDescription: Quick-start with pre-built templates or use natural language commands for easy interaction.
enumTitles: Lead Intelligence - Track sales leads and interactions
Customer Support - Build a knowledge base and FAQ system
Research Assistant - Organize academic and market research
Competitor Intelligence - Monitor competitors and market trends
Content Library - Manage content ideas and references
Product Catalog - E-commerce product knowledge base

command.title: Natural Language Command
command.description: Tell the AI what you want in plain English. Examples: 'remember that John prefers email', 'what do you know about customers', 'find similar products'
command.prefill: what do you know about customers
command.example: remember that the client prefers meetings on Tuesday

numClusters.title: Number of Clusters
numClusters.description: How many groups to organize your memories into based on similarity
numClusters.sectionDescription: Automatically group similar memories together to discover patterns and themes in your data.

embeddingModel.title: Embedding Model
embeddingModel.description: Model used to convert text into vector embeddings for semantic search
embeddingModel.sectionDescription: Fine-tune the underlying models and algorithms. Most users can leave these at their defaults.

seed.title: Random Seed
seed.description: Set a seed for reproducible results across runs

storageBackend.title: Storage Backend
storageBackend.description: Choose how and where to persist your memory embeddings. Different backends offer different trade-offs for scalability, persistence, and features.
storageBackend.sectionDescription: Configure advanced vector storage options. Choose from 8 backends including cloud vector databases, hyperbolic embeddings, and local storage.
enumTitles: Apify Binary - Default, 4x smaller than JSON (recommended)
Hyperbolic - Poincaré ball for hierarchical data

qdrantApiKey.title: Qdrant API Key
qdrantApiKey.description: API key for Qdrant Cloud authentication

weaviateApiKey.title: Weaviate API Key
weaviateApiKey.description: API key for Weaviate Cloud authentication

curvature.title: Hyperbolic Curvature
curvature.description: Curvature parameter for Poincaré ball model (higher = more curved, better for deep hierarchies)

hyperbolicClustering.title: Enable Hyperbolic Clustering
hyperbolicClustering.description: Use hyperbolic k-means for hierarchical data clustering (better for tree-like relationships)
